text:
- Switzerland is one of the
most innovative countries

in the world.
(bright music)
- Here in Switzerland,
there is a lot of technical companies
and multinational corporations,
and we are helping them

to modernize their business
and innovate their business.
- I always wanted to have the opportunity

to really change the complete
way of working for customers.
- I wanted to be in a place
where I can actually be a pioneer,
where I can be an entrepreneur.

- The startup spirit within
AWS is truly amazing.
- When you talk to your colleagues,
you feel they are all entrepreneurs,
they're innovators, and they're builders.
- So being a builder at AWS, for me,
means really that we always have open eyes

for unsolved customer
issues and challenges.

- So for me, it was
important to be able to work

on innovation, work closer
to customers, as well,
and really being able to invent.

- I joined five years ago,
and over those five years,

I have seen the company
grow exponentially,
and that's been so exciting to see.
- In order to work at AWS,
you don't need a technical background.
- We have so many different roles at AWS.

We have marketing team.
We have sales teams.

The opportunity to join AWS is
more about being interested,

being in love with what
technology can do for others.
- I think when you join from outside,

you think of AWS as
this big global company.
Actually, when you join,

you have this dynamic environment
with a startup feeling.

- The most exciting part of
my job is the constant change
that we are having.
- People are very positive.
You can try out new things.
- By working with these people.

You can really achieve the
best version of yourself.

- I'm so happily surprised when
joining here in Switzerland

that I came to a team
that's highly diverse.
- I know about AWS Switzerland
from an inclusion diversity event.

- One of the key things one
need to know is basically

to be honest and bring their
own personality into the table
because we appreciate diversity at AWS.

- I'm a co-lead for Inclusion,
Diversity and Equity
at AWS Switzerland

where we strive to build an
inclusive workplace here.

- I got dedicated mentorship
and very flexible working style
and also many growing opportunities.
- I've had a lot of opportunity to grow.
It is absolutely a career highlight for me

as a woman in tech to be a
principal security specialist
for Amazon Web Services,
and its something I'm pretty proud
to talk to my daughters about, as well.

- You end up with such
a diverse mix of people
with a diverse mix of experience.
You always have something you can learn
from some other people.

- The biggest surprise when
joining AWS was the culture.

- First time I learned about
the leadership principles,
I feel very excited about them

because it just resonated
very well with me.
- I didn't expect the company
to really live by the cultural principle

that they're sharing with
the rest of the world.
This leadership principle,

this cultural attribute
of the companies are real.
And they're part of everything we do
on a day-to-day basis.
- As we say, it's always day one.
So everything is possible,

and you can really change
things for the best.
(bright music continues)
